topic.title: Is USV video format doable?
topic.body:
I'm creating a video format that contains text data and .png frames inside a compressed .7z file.
Site: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HDMywbRZkin9HhmheaDFHCzaZhCfLhZLH/
According to the words in the site:
"Do you imagine if we have the power of YouTube's videos in a file on our devices? A USV file can have credits to the authors, multiple language subtitles/audios, indicative rating, tags, etc. All it embedded into a single video file!"

But to read a single data, would not be necessary to decompress all files?
Would not be better to simply use links as metadata in WEBM files?

Thanks in advance for your concerns and suggestions.

topic.title: ZeroNet Plus - discussion topic
topic.body:
Hi!
I'm developing an app to give more features to ZeroNet.
This app is developed using the Construct 2 game engine.

Do you want to easily enable/disable your plugins and install new ones?

Custom download folders, decentralized updates, better ZeroHello page, new domain extensions and live streamming are missing features?

ZeroNet+ and its plugin are developed to achieve those and other features.

Comment and share your througts,
Zite and app is to be released soon, so follow this topic.

topic.title: Eventlr - discussion topic
topic.body:
Eventlr is the app for who doesn't understand or dislikes programmation.
In Eventlr, user can create zites/apps without programming knowledge, with a easy-to-use visual editor, with events in a sheet: conditions/actions.

If you have questions or suggestions, please comment in this topic.
To receive updates, follow this topic in newsfeed.

topic.title: ZeroMe/Peeper: New updates on ChameleonHub
topic.body:
New updates on [ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/):

* Added favicon and logo
* Limit: 97.00kB (double from SunHub), but it can be increased after we review your request
* Updated design and phrases
* User can send a email to request a increase in the data limit

If you want to know how to switch from your hub to [ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/), ask me.

Soon Peeper will be relaunched, and both [Peeper](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/?Profile/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe/daniell@zeroid.bit)/[ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/) will support [KxoID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GTVetvjTEriCMzKzWSP9FahYoMPy6BG1P/).

topic.title: List of most needed things for ZeroNet
topic.body:
* Cryptocurrency

* Sites handling against bad content on start page (for sample, NSFW)
* Better localization/multilanguage
* Data synced on multiple devices
* Clearnet [most needed services/apps](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BVGUB9cyZjUJJbRtQZmgS4YpZE1v8Nn1R/needed.html), with similar sites on ZeroNet
* Recommended decentralized ID (that relies on ZeroNet, working for mesh network users)
* P2P ZeroNet updates as default
* Help offline users gets files from online users (LocalAnnounce plugin)
* Built-in with mesh networks that are discoverable by offline users

* Protection for proxies (filters, mod review, logs, terms of use)
* Friendly user login on proxies
* Dedicated proxies: Clearnet presence and attraction to ZeroNet
* Incentive clearnet proxies users to download ZeroNet

* Dedicated program/app for a zite

* Share API
* Support IPv6
* Built-in in operating systems
* Browser to access zero:// protocol
* URL rewriting (no /?/ in the URLs)

* Proof-of-work
* Verification on ZeroID
* Ads

Updated version of this list on [GitHub](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1621).

Well, if you see this [stats](https://www.statista.com/statistics/273018/number-of-internet-users-worldwide/), even on 2005 Internet had more than 1 billion people.

# How do I envision ZeroNet to be ready for mass of users

* [On ZeroMedium](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeromedium.bit/?/15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe/part-2-how-do-i-envision-zeronet-to-be-ready-for-mass-of-users).

topic.title: The first decentralized ID provider (KxoID) now is implemented on ZeroMe
topic.body:
[Peeper](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/) and [ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/) now supports signup/login with KxoID, the first decentralized ID provider with unique usernames.

If you want to use KxoID on ZeroMe, you need to use Peeper (when you need to signup/login, after it you can use ZeroMe) and move your profile to [KxoHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LqcxtENM69yBggxPYLaj87J4bqon5SVwU/) or ChameleonHub.

topic.title: Don't get hacked
topic.body:
# ZeroNet is with a critical security flaw

If you received a alert about new update, is because of it.
I already figure out how this can be exploited, but I can't share the details.
You is in risk, both if you don't update your client, and if you update via the ZeroHello/ZeroUpdate.

# Don't get hacked

**I ADVICE TO ALL USERS, DOESN'T UPDATE FROM ZEROHELLO. DOWNLOAD FROM GITHUB AND ADD TO /CORE FOLDER. ALSO CLONE THE REPO INTO THE /CORE FOLDER, SO YOU CAN ANALYZE WHAT ARE THE FILES CHANGED**.
I'm open to teach how to setup it.

topic.title: After updating to the latest ZeroNet (rev3616)
topic.body:
**IF YOU DON'T FOLLOW THIS TUTORIAL, YOU IS IN RISK TO HAVE A HACKED VERSION OF ZERONET!**

[Hope you updated ZeroNet manually, with git, instead of risky updating it from ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1538339767_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe).

I suggest you all to delete ZeroUpdate zite, close ZeroHello and patch ZeroHello from git. Or delete ZeroHello and download again.

topic.title: How to enable IPv6 and make ZeroNet more accessible/secure/reliable
topic.body:
Download:
https://github.com/tangdou1/ZeroNet/archive/patch-2.zip
and extract it to your ZeroNet's core folder.

If you want to begin with a IPv6 tracker, you can add this: zero://fc81:4668:5a19:0c29:9dfe:ed94:d745:85c9

# How to create and share your own IPv6 tracker
1. On Windows, download [CJDNS installer](https://github.com/interfect/cjdns-installer). On Linux, download CJDNS from apt or other method you want. Ask me and I'll help about your questions.
2. Close ZeroNet. Install and run CJDNS and make sure it is working properly
3. Go to your ZeroNet folder, enter on core folder and then plugins folder
4. Find the disabled-Bootstrapper folder, and remove the disabled-
5. Open your ZeroNet
6. Copy your IPv6 address and share it

topic.title: Your zite supporting dark theme with no efforts
topic.body:
# Your zite supporting dark theme with no efforts

FrameworkJS, the ZeroNet first click-to-clone framework, now supports ZeroNet automatic dark theme.
If you begin your ZeroNet zite with FrameworkJS, your project will automatically support dark/light themes.

Also, VueJS/AngularJS has been replaced by Twitter's Bootstrap.

If you see big buttons, it is because FrameworkJS is yet on beta development stage, and fixing bugs after implementation of Bootstrap.

* [Test FrameworkJS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/fmwk.bit/)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/fmwk.bit/

topic.title: My trading group about cryptocurrencies
topic.body:
# My trading group about cryptocurrencies
## On Telegram
**Note**: this is not like the others, that are scamming. And we don't give pump/dump signals, but shows crypto articles and suggestions of promising new coins/tokens.
https://t.me/btcaltcoins
Please invite your friends: depending on the growth of the group, we can expand it to other media.

topic.title: FrameworkJS has been launched!
topic.body:
# FrameworkJS has been launched!
**On ZeroNet, no need to recreate the same things for every new project you begin. Framework.js already comes with the basic libs and features ZeroNet needs**.

It already includes the basic features expected from a web framework, plus more!
It includes, for reading: Headings, Paragraphs, Blockquotes, Badges, Images, Navbar, Logo
For forms: buttons, sticky buttons, inputs, text areas
For webpage/app: navbar/header, header menu, navmenu, scroller, footer
Other elements: Tiled lists, longcard lists
CSS classes: .full-size, .no-opacity, .color, .color-bg

**For ZeroNet, FrameworkJS is the first usable framework, and the world's first click-to-clone web framework.
On FrameworkJS site, just click "Create your own zite", and it will redirect to your brand new project. You can also use FrameworkJS on your current project.
Zite owner can call JS to clone your own site or another site. Also, FrameworkJS is doing the begin of UltraApps with the detection of clearnet/zeronet, and supports ZeroNet dark theme. It also comes with the most useful ZeroNet libs**.

Framework isn't better, because ZeroNet didn't implemented yet the new features I suggested for site clonning.

FrameworkJS also includes Bootstrap and Material Design ready to use.

Use it on your project, and copy/paste the JS/CSS (except the custom ones) when a new version of Framework is launched.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/fmwk.bit/
http://framework.js.org/
https://github.com/Plasnerd/Framework.js/releases/tag/r1

1530097903_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
Dowloading the repo.
You can use channels feature.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?12NptcFqnsxiydK4W8VLK6EwjpbZS3bTHS/16@15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe

Do you have a ZeroMe profile?
I think Subscriber function and Videos sorted into categories (e.g. movies, xxx, music, etc) are the most needed features.

You can also create a dynamic page ranking the most subscribed profiles.
Also, user can upload profile pic and bio.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_357_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Thank you, i first thought the subscribe button is to follow video comments on ZeroHello news feed. My Subbed section is somehow crowded now :)

> [thunder33345](#comment_172_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): hmm we should have subscribe and newsfeed

> [glightstar](#comment_86_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): As for "A nicer looking video player", you might want to check out Plyr (GitHub).I've used it in previous projects (like a long time ago, when it had even fewer features), and it was a very nice experience, both developing with it and actually using it!I believe it also has subtitle-support, so that could potentially save you a lot of time there.

> [quantumkitty](#comment_167_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): It's pretty much up to people's intuition at the moment. As long as we keep out immoral stuff like child porn, we should be good.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_382_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Good news! I want to add some feedback regarding subscription. The subscribe button may be confusing on what it does. There can be follow button to follow(subscribe) new comments. Not sure if it would be possible/pretty if there is some tooltip or the popup prompt "Are you sure you want to subscribe this user videos?"The Subscribe section would contain switch where user can disable being notified about new videos on ZeroHello newsfeed.

1533701473_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy.body:
USV videos are programable, so the video author can program that in some minutes will appear a button for user like or subscribe.
This would fit WEBM videos?
If .7z files could list the prioritized files to be decompressed, so the metadata could be embedded and the format achieved without rely on WEBM.

> [leftside](#comment_183_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Image links in http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HDMywbRZkin9HhmheaDFHCzaZhCfLhZLH/ are broken?

No, as I saw in [ZeroGate](http://zerogate.tk/1HDMywbRZkin9HhmheaDFHCzaZhCfLhZLH/).

> [leftside](#comment_184_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Oh, linked sites blocks tor-browser's IPs. [...]

What is .odt? Is for video?

> [leftside](#comment_185_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): .odt file format for Libreoffice (open source free word processing software). It's ZIP file and has various info just like your USV formet.

.docx, .jar and .apk are also compressed files.
USV is not about a video that is a compressed .7z file, it have other features.

1534202005_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: Another needed feature on ZeroTalk is a page with all our posts.

1534205182_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy.body: [Invited developers to create a basic Plugin Store](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe/1534266341).

> [bart101](#comment_4_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY5hYB8): Create a content management system for Zeroblog so people can change the background from white and add a header without needing to get into the CSS file or any other file to code. Some people hate coding and the Zeroblog needs a lot of improvement.

ZeroMedium can achieve it.

> [bart101](#comment_6_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY5hYB8): You can make a zite like Hexo if you want to code shit. I hate coding. I want an admin panel or something for ZeroBlog so I can add a header or change the background of the Zeroblog, something like the admin panel that wordpress has. Non-coders will never create a zite on Zeronet if there is coding involved. The white background of Zeroblog looks like crap and I want to use a photo for the background.

I can tell you how to change the background, if you want.
Regarding about coding, me too, I don't like it.
I'm creating a app to create zites without programmation knowledge, with events: conditions/actions in a visual event sheet editor.

> [bart101](#comment_7_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY5hYB8): What's ZeroMedium?

This can't power blogs like ZeroBlog, yet.

ZeroMedium is like Medium, a platform to publish posts.

> [bart101](#comment_8_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY5hYB8): I hope the app your working on turns out ok.

I'll not implement PeakID (centralized) and KaffieID/CryptoID (not unique names) on chameleon.bit.
Regarding CryptoID, I abandonned it, and uses the same source of KaffieID with very little modifications to make it work.

> [wulf](#comment_17_1AdgRmF4CQZRJVUf7t7GWmETZc2fq6PuBy): Your node isn't reachable to participate in the overlay network if you're not already reachable via the clearnet, that's how VPNs work. So you are entirely still reliant on your ISP and an address allocation.  [...]

You don't understand the point of CJDNS, or simply is lying about what you already know

> [wulf](#comment_18_1AdgRmF4CQZRJVUf7t7GWmETZc2fq6PuBy): This isn't correct. CJDNS isn't faster than other types of VPN or distributed routing platforms. And its still entirely dependent on your ISP.

> [wulf](#comment_19_1AdgRmF4CQZRJVUf7t7GWmETZc2fq6PuBy): I will say, for clarity that I was incorrect about CJDNS not using IPv6. It is using Unique Local Addressing (private IPv6 addressing) for the CJDNS node addresses. These however are not routable over the public internet in the same way and for the same reason as IPv4 RFC1918 private addresses.

CJDNS is to route on itself, without relying on ISP.
We know it actually relies on ISP, and for now, but it wasn't created for this behavior

> [wulf](#comment_18_1AdgRmF4CQZRJVUf7t7GWmETZc2fq6PuBy): This isn't correct. CJDNS isn't faster than other types of VPN or distributed routing platforms. And its still entirely dependent on your ISP.

CJDNS is faster than any other IPv4 or similar mesh network software.
It depends on ISP because we make it depend on ISP (no enough CJDNS to connect directly on local networks)

> [eightyfour](#comment_7_191jbK3GNmVritcMymKkFuxyYFXxqv2xpC): This isn't censorship, the owner - or someone with access to their computer - took the site down. When more people are using ZeroNet such things will become more difficult because people will be archiving/cloning sites more. Automatic archiving could be an interesting feature to implement, but most people don't want to set the required diskspace aside, so it should be opt-in only.

Not opt-in, but opt-out. Lots of newbie users maybe don't care about it, and doesn't knows how to enable it.
Archiving sites is more important than disk storage.
But detect if disk haves enough storage to archive, and when it is reaching limit, show a dialog that user can disable it or clean some uneeded commits/snapshots on archives.

> [nekololi](#comment_289_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): that is certainly going overboard. i probably have a hundred sites im connected to. i don't need an archive of each site every time each of them updates. and then there are sites like zerome hubs that update multiple times in an hour. i don't need multiple backups of sites like that, constantly being generated and written to my disk. my disk space is much more important than dozens of pointless archives of sites i don't honestly care that much about but still remain connected to purely because there isn't a reason not to (automatic archiving would be a good reason for me to purge 90% of the sites i have). [...]

Not for every file, but the files you're seeding. And not every update, but commits. Archive based on git. And prompted on every site if user want to archive.
